item.title: Need help
item.dc:creator: @Galook Galook
item.description:
@Galook wrote:

you mean something like this?

class noob {
    public static void main(String[] arguments) 
    {
         int[] vars = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5}; // if you already know the data in the arrays, use this format
         
         int num = 0;
         while(num < vars.length) // continue through the whole array
         {
             System.out.println("This is loop #" + num + " the variable in this position in the array is: " + vars[num]);
         }        
    }
}

what exactly do you want a tut on? ill make one, jsut tell me on what. also, what programming language do you know besides Java(even something like SCAR)?

Read full topic

item.title: Need help
item.dc:creator: @oblivian oblivian
item.description:
@oblivian wrote:

check it out i disided to learn JAVA could someone test it and make all the vars arrays i dont fully understand them yet. and instead of repeating the system.out.println(ect could u just put it once thx!

class noob {
        public static void main(String[] arguments) {	
             int number = 100:
             int first = 1;
             int sec = 2;
             int third = 3;
             int fourth = 4;
             int fith = 5;
     
 do{system.out.println("this is the :" +first "loop that you have went through"}
 while(number = 100);     
       number = number + 100;
 
 do{system.out.println("this is the :" +sec "loop that you have went through"}
while(number = 200);     
       number = number + 100;

do{system.out.println("this is the :" +third "loop that you have went through"}
while(number = 300);     
       number = number + 100;

do{system.out.println("this is the :" +fourth "loop that you have went through"}
while(number = 400);     
       number = number + 100;

do{system.out.println("this is the :" +fith "loop that you have went through"}
while(number = 500);     
       number = number + 100;

	
          }
}

ps. if any1 has any tuts will be very thankful
